profile.description:
The profile to be used to interact with AWS Secrets Manager.
If not set, the default profile created with `aws configure` will be used.

region.description:
AWS Region to be used to interact with AWS Secrets Manager.
Examples are us-east-1, us-west-2, etc.

Alicloud Region to be used to interact with Alicloud Secrets Manager.
Examples are cn-beijing, cn-shanghai, etc.

environmentType.description:
EnvironmentType specifies the Azure cloud environment endpoints to use for connecting and authenticating with Azure.
By-default it points to the public cloud AAD endpoint, and the following endpoints are available:
PublicCloud, USGovernmentCloud, ChinaCloud, GermanCloud
Ref: https://github.com/Azure/go-autorest/blob/main/autorest/azure/environments.go#L152

tenantId.description: TenantID configures the Azure Tenant to send requests to.

vaultUrl.description: Vault Url from which the secrets to be fetched from.

configs.description: Configs contains config items of the backend, whose keys differ from different backend types.

type.description: Type is the backend type, supports BackendTypeLocal, BackendTypeOss, BackendTypeS3.

default.description: Default is default block of the module config.

configs.description: Configs contains all levels of module configs

path.description: Path is the path of the module. It can be a local path or a remote URL

version.description: Version is the version of the module.

name.description: platform name of the provider

alicloud.description: Alicloud configures a store to retrieve secrets from Alicloud Secrets Manager.

aws.description: AWS configures a store to retrieve secrets from AWS Secrets Manager.

azure.description: Azure configures a store to retrieve secrets from Azure KeyVault.

fake.description: Fake configures a store with static key/value pairs

onpremises.description: Onprem configures a store in on-premises environments

vault.description: Vault configures a store to retrieve secrets from HashiCorp Vault.

viettelcloud.description: ViettelCloud configures a store to retrieve secrets from ViettelCloud Secrets Manager.

attributes.description: Attributes represents all specified attributes of this resource

dependsOn.description: DependsOn contains all resources this resource depends on

extensions.description: Extensions specifies arbitrary metadata of this resource

id.description:
ID is the unique key of this resource.
ApiVersion:Kind:Namespace:Name is an idiomatic way for Kubernetes resources.
providerNamespace:providerName:resourceType:resourceName for Terraform resources

type.description: Type represents all Context we supported like Kubernetes and Terraform

context.description: Context contains workspace-level configurations, such as runtimes, topologies, and metadata, etc.

resources.description: Resources is the list of Resource this Spec contains.

secretStore.description: SecretSore represents a external secret store location for storing secrets.

path.description: Path is the mount path of the Vault KV backend endpoint, e.g: "secret".

server.description: Server is the target Vault server address to connect, e.g: "https://vault.example.com:8200".

version.description:
Version is the Vault KV secret engine version. Version can be either "v1" or
"v2", defaults to "v2".

cmpURL.description:
ViettelCloud CMP URL to be used to interact with ViettelCloud Secrets Manager.
Examples are https://console.viettelcloud.vn/api/

projectID.description: ProjectID to be used to interact with ViettelCloud Secrets Manager.

action.description: the operation performed by this step

owners.description: Owners is a list of owners for the project.

path.description: Path is the relative path of the project within the sources.

sourceID.description: SourceID is the configuration source id associated with the project.

description.description: Description is a human-readable description of the source.

id.description: ID is the id of the source.

labels.description: Labels are custom labels associated with the source.

name.description: Name is the name of the source.

owners.description: Owners is a list of owners for the source.

remote.description: Remote is the source URL, including scheme.

sourceProvider.description: SourceProvider is the type of the source provider.

description.description: Description is a human-readable description of the stack.

desiredVersion.description: DesiredVersion is the desired revision of stack.

id.description: ID is the id of the stack.

labels.description: Labels are custom labels associated with the stack.

name.description: Name is the name of the stack.

owners.description: Owners is a list of owners for the stack.

path.description: Path is the relative path of the stack within the source.

projectID.description: ProjectID is the project id of the stack within the source.

projectName.description: ProjectName is the project name of the stack within the source.

type.description: Type is the type of the stack.

name.description: Name is the name of the variable.

type.description: Type is the type of the variable.

value.description: Value is the value of the variable.

variableSet.description: VariableSet is the variable set to which the variable belongs.

labels.description: Labels clarifies the scope of the variable set.

name.description: Name is the name of the variable set.

description.description: Description is a human-readable description of the workspace.

id.description: ID is the id of the workspace.

labels.description: Labels are custom labels associated with the workspace.

name.description: Name is the name of the workspace.

owners.description: Owners is a list of owners for the workspace.

context.description: Context contains workspace-level configurations, such as runtimes, topologies, and metadata, etc.

modules.description: Modules are the configs of a set of modules.

secretStore.description: SecretStore represents a secure external location for storing secrets.

forceQuery.description: append a query ('?') even if RawQuery is empty

host.description: host or host:port (see Hostname and Port methods)

path.description: path (relative paths may omit leading slash)
